metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2549 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
sound/core/hrtimer.c in the Linux kernel before 4.4.1 does not preventrecursive callback access, which allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (deadlock) via a crafted ioctl call.However, the previous fix is still insufficient: it may stillcause a lockup when the ALSA timer instance reprograms itselfin its callback. Then it invokes the start function even insnd_timer_interrupt() that is called in hrtimer callback itself, resultsin a CPU stall. This is no hypothetical problem but actually triggeredby syzkaller fuzzer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2549` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-4.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-4.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-4.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required
